title: Calories in a T-Bone Steak
meta_description: Discover calories in a tbone, with full nutrition breakdown for a typical 12 oz cooked portion including protein, fat, and cooking tweaks.
assumptions: Broiled or grilled, choice grade beef, bone-in with lean and fat, edible portion ~340 g (12 oz cooked weight); no added marinades or oils.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by steak size, fat trim, grade, cooking method, and doneness. Values based on USDA averages; check labels or sources for specifics.

quick_answer.text: A typical 12 oz cooked T-bone steak provides ~1010 kcal and ~85 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison with labels.

faqs.q: How many calories in a T-bone steak?
faqs.a: About 1010 kcal for a typical 12 oz cooked T-bone steak with lean and fat.

faqs.q: What's the protein content in a T-bone?
faqs.a: Roughly 85 g of protein per 12 oz cooked steak.

faqs.q: Is a T-bone steak high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, around 75 g total fat, including 31 g saturated, due to the fat cap and marbling.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in a tbone?
faqs.a: Broiling or grilling keeps calories similar; frying or adding oil can increase by 100+ kcal.

faqs.q: What's the cholesterol in a T-bone steak?
faqs.a: Approximately 299 mg per 12 oz cooked portion.
